original: ROSENGREN, Gunnar Rudolf, Direktör, Limhamn, f Limh 4/9 89, gm Ida Sörensson. 1 gjutarelära i Limh 03—07, Malmö Tekn Aftonsk 03—07, prakt v Ludwigsbergs o Bergsunds gjuterier Sthlm 08—09, v metall- o konstgjuterier Berlin 11, stud konstgjutning Paris 28. Gjutmäst v J N Rosengrens Metall-gjuteri i Limh 12—30, vkst dir sed. 30. Ordf i Limh Hantv.frn 25—28, v. ordf sed. 28 o v. ordf i frris byggn.styr samt ålderman i dess ordenssällsk, v. ordf i Sv Gjutmästarefrbs Malmöavd, styr.led i Drottn Josefinas Slöjdsk f flickor, huvudman o rev i Limh Sparbk. J N Rosengrens Metallgjuteri grund av framlidne fabr J N R 09 o ombild t AB 30. Anläggn omf nu 10 degelugnar o l elektr smältugn. Fman utför såväl konstgjutn som beställn t maskinind.
translated: ROSENGREN, Gunnar Rudolf, Director, Limhamn, b. Limh 4/9 89, m. Ida Sörensson. 1st apprenticeship in Limh 1903-1907, Malmö Technical Evening School 1903-1907, practical training at Ludwigsberg and Bergsunds foundries in Stockholm 1908-1909, at metal and art foundries in Berlin 1911, studied art casting in Paris 1928. Casting master at J N Rosengrens Metallurgical Foundry in Limh 1912-1930, promoted to managing director since 1930. Chairman of Limh Craft Association from 1925-1928, vice-chairman since 1928 and vice-chairman of the former building committee and alderman in its order society, vice-chairman of the Swedish Foundry Masters Association's Malmö branch, board member of Drottn Josefinas Handicraft School for girls, trustee and auditor at Limh Savings Bank. J N Rosengrens Metallurgical Foundry founded by the late manufacturer J N R in 1909 and transformed into a limited company in 1930. The facility now includes 10 crucible furnaces and one electric melting furnace. The company carries out both art casting and commissioned machine work.

structured.name: Gunnar Rudolf Rosengren
structured.description: Gunnar Rudolf Rosengren was a distinguished director from Limhamn who had an extensive career in the field of casting and metalwork. He was born on September 4, 1889, in Limhamn. He was married to Ida Sörensson. His educational foundation includes an apprenticeship in Limhamn from 1903 to 1907 and attending Malmö Technical Evening School during the same period. Rosengren gained practical experience at Ludwigsberg and Bergsunds foundries in Stockholm from 1908 to 1909, followed by work at metal and art foundries in Berlin in 1911. In 1928, he studied art casting in Paris. From 1912 to 1930, Rosengren served as the Casting Master at J N Rosengrens Metallurgical Foundry in Limhamn, after which he was promoted to become the Managing Director, a position he held until his retirement. Besides his professional work, Rosengren held various leadership roles in organizations such as the Limh Craft Association, where he served as Chairman from 1925 to 1928, and the Swedish Foundry Masters Association, where he was a Vice Chairman since 1928. He was also involved in the Former Building Committee and served as an alderman in its order society. Rosengren actively contributed to the development of the community, serving as a board member of Drottn Josefinas Handicraft School and acting as a Trustee at Limh Savings Bank. Gunnar Rudolf Rosengren's Luminary Foundry, founded in 1909 by the late manufacturer J N R and transformed into a limited company in 1930, specialized in both art casting and commissioned machine work. The foundry currently boasts 10 crucible furnaces and one electric melting furnace.
